title: Château Bianca 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Pretty, pale and poised, this offers light pear flavors with a touch of cinnamon. Snappy acidity and a clean, fresh finish all contribute.

title: Albet I Noya 2011 Brut Natural Reserva Sparkling (Penedès)
description: Leesy fleshy papaya aromas come with a touch of sulfur and harshness. This feels solid, albeit modest in bubbles. Flavors of apple and green melon are lasting and steady on the finish.

title: Avancia 2014 Cuvee de O Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Leesy white-fruit aromas come with hints of corn and slate. This feels plump but not too heavy to be cut by a beam of firm acidity. Chunky leesy flavors of apple and kiwi finish fleshy, pulpy and round. Drink immediately.

title: Barale Fratelli 2011 Cannubi  (Barolo)
description: This opens with aromas of forest floor, grilled porcini, scorched earth and espresso. The lean palate offers raw red berry, sage and aniseed alongside bracing tannins and nervous acidity.

title: Donkey & Goat 2014 Helluva Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: An effusive wine, this shows potent, almost sweet aromas and opulent flavors with hints of mint and rosemary. It has a medium body, fine tannins that add nicely to the texture and a lingering finish.

title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Müller-Burggraef) 2014 Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)
description: Luscious peach and blossom notes perfume this plucky off-dry Riesling. Laced with honey and tart tangerine acidity, it's easy, fresh and approachable. Drink now.

title: Domaine Gérard Duplessis 2013 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)
description: Montée de Tonnerre, just to the south of the Grand Cru slope, gives rich wines like this with density and ripeness. From the warm vintage of 2013, this is a ripe, apple- and pear-flavored wine that has just the hint of a tighter, mineral texture. It can be drunk now.

title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2014  Mâcon-Villages
description: This ripe, still very young wine has a tangy, mineral texture that cuts into the white fruit flavors. Acidity, creamy texture and flavors of melon and apricots all give this wine the potential to be deliciously fruity. Drink from 2017.

title: Finca Constancia 2013 Parcela 52 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Despite opening with a yellow color and waxy oily peach aromas, this benefits from zesty lemon-like acidity. Flavors of quince and apple are oaky, while effusive acidity keeps this Verdejo fresh on the finish, which is otherwise big and full. Drink now.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Forget-Brimont NV Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This ripe, stylish and attractively textured nonvintage has plenty of fruit, apples and citrus dominating. A mineral, tight acidity gives the wine a crisp, crunchy character.

title: Foundry 2013 Catie's Corner Viognier (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a light, crisp white from a tremendous vineyard source. A mix of cucumber and white peach at the heart of this wine makes it seem lighter than it is. Oaky caramel vanilla closes out the finish.

title: Eco Terreno 2013 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)
description: In this gold-colored wine, green-apple skin and nutmeg-ginger spice wrap around a full-bodied build, with a preponderance of ripe peach within its makeup too. Decadent, and nutty from the oak, it brings a fulsomeness of crème brûlée to the finish.

title: Louis Max 2013 Vignes du Domaine  (Mercurey)
description: With a touch of wood aging, this ripe and creamy wine has a light edge of toast. Crisp with lemon and ripe with apricots, it has a fresh character that is filled out and given richness with a touch of honey at the end. Drink from 2016.

title: Malabaila 2012 Bric Volta  (Roero)
description: This is infused with engaging scents of red berry, crushed violet, rose and a balsamic whiff of eucalyptus. The linear palate is tightly wound, offering dried wild cherry and a note of light baking spice accompanied by rather austere tannins. Drink after 2018.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2013 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: Well integrated in terms of barrel use (listed as 60% used French oak and 40% new), this features a robust exuberance of fruit, from Asian pear to Meyer lemon. Spicy with a touch of nutmeg and ginger, it hones a fine line of minerality throughout.

title: Mirassou 2014 Moscato (California)
description: This is a great find in this category. Gentle, floral notes of honey and apple mark nose and palate. The light body gives a charming, almost delicate character to this well-balanced and refreshing sweet wine.

title: Monte Ferro 2013 Bradley Vineyard Pinot Noir (Elkton Oregon)
description: Sourced from old-vine Wädenswil clones, this effort carries the new Elkton AVA designation. Pretty raspberry and strawberry fruit is set in lightly toasty tannins. This is a lovely everyday Pinot Noir with some density.

title: Monteviejo 2014 Petite Fleur Torrontés (Cafayate)
description: Tropical fruit aromas are suggestive of bath soap and body oil. This feels obtuse, with depth and an oily sensation to the palate. Chunky, ripe, oily flavors of melon and orange finish loud and ripe, with a deeper set of tropical fruit flavors than your average Argentine Torrontés.

title: Morra Diego 2011  Barolo
description: Delicate aromas of red rose and wild berry lead the nose while the taut palate offers raw sour cherry, anise, cinnamon and mocha. Bracing tannins lead to a firm, drying finish.

title: Moselland 2013 Jahrgang Riesling (Mosel)
description: A whiff of crushed chalk lends some complexity to this crisp refreshing Riesling full of fresh apple, tangerine and lemon flavors. Off-dry on the palate, it's a juicy widely appealing wine for youthful consumption.

title: Jean Milan NV Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Extra Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Fresh and fruity, this wine comes from Grand Cru vineyards in Oger in the Côte des Blancs. With its soft texture and ripe character, it's an attractive wine with bright citrus and pear flavors. The mineral streak, though, seems to be missing.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Extra Brut

title: Grafen Neipperg 2012 Trocken Lemberger (Württemberg)
description: While dry in style, sumptuous black cherry and cassis notes lend a plummy feel to this Lemberger. It's an uncomplicated welcoming wine that's a bit plush in mouthfeel but invigorated by bright cranberry acidity on the finish. Drink now.

title: Outlander 2013 Meritage (Paso Robles)
description: Lush aromas of black cherry, vanilla, kola nut and blackberry fudge pack lots of action into this bottling. The palate confirms the complexity, with blueberry and black cherry backed by pipe tobacco, dried marjoram and a pencil lead-driven structure.

title: Panther Creek 2013 French Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: Sourced from 35-year-old Wente clone vines, this offers bright apple with hints of peach. It's medium bodied and streaked with flavors of caramel and butterfinger candy.

title: Panther Creek 2013 Kalita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Floral scents float above a chunky, cherry-fruited, single-vineyard wine. It's quite refreshing, with appealing texture and underlying minerality that compensates for the overall impression of palate lightness. Drink now through 2018, while the freshness remains at its peak.

title: Rusack 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: The winery's entry-level bottling, this offers turned earth, juniper, cola and ripe red cherries on the nose. The cherries carry to the palate, where they meet with tangy cranberries, oregano-thyme herbs and grippy plum skin tannins that last into a solid finish.

title: Rutherford Hill 2012 Barrel Select Red (Napa Valley)
description: Sanguine, this Merlot-dominant blend is juicy with well-toned structure and length. Smaller percentages of Syrah and Malbec provide succulence and softness, while also offering a density of black cherry and berry, finished in dark chocolate.

title: Rainstorm 2014 Pinot Gris (Oregon)
description: Offering fine flavor for the price, this release emphasizes spice over fruit, with a sharp, slightly herbal edge. Crisp apple and pear show ginger highlights. Drink this lightly chilled with some spicy Thai food.

title: Siot 2013 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh-pressed blackberry aromas leap out of the glass of this wine, along with asphalt and a touch of purple flowers. The palate is a study of density and thickness, with black plums, coffee and espresso showing most out of the deep, black flavors.

title: San Simeon 2014 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Crisp and fresh aromas of lime sorbet and iced apple flesh greet the nose on this Riboli family bottling. The palate is steely and bright, with Anjou pear flesh, a bit of smoke and some red-apple ripeness.
